planet.name: Gliese 504 b
GJ 504 b
HIP 64792 b
HD 115383 b
planet.description: Gliese 504 b is the first directly imaged planet on a wide orbit around a G-type main-sequence star with a mass similar to that of our Sun. The planet is a gas giant, about 4 times more massive than Jupiter. It was discovered by the SEEDS survey.
planet.imagedescription:
This is an actual image of the exoplanet Gliese 504 b and its host star. It was taken by the SEEDS survey.
Credit: Kuzuhara et al. (2013).
